1.Text:
One day, Cid brandishes his sword alone in the
forest.

(Lately, it's all been actual combat. But as
someone aiming to be a shadowbroker,
I can't afford to skimp on my training.)

(Sure, I could take up Zen, waterfall meditation,
mindfulness, fasting, yoga... Not that there's
anything wrong with any of those.)

(But what matters more is regularly sticking to the
plain old classic training.)

...Still, something's missing. It's not about how
much I'm training. It's more internal...

Imagine facing an ultra-tough opponent or suddenly
feeling like my power had been reset... Some sort of
thrilling twist—
...Boss man?
Wait, Delta? It's been a while—
Bossss maaaan!!!

As Delta rushes toward him, Cid recalls a memory from
his past.

(I thought it looked familiar. That truck that hit
me... Why am I thinking of it now...?)

(Right, this might be a good opportunity.
It's important to return to one's roots.)
There, there, Delta! Come here—
Whaaaat?!

Delta's fierce charge sends Cid's body flying through
the air.
Guargh!

Then, he intentionally slams his head against a
sizable rock on the ground.

Boss! Hey, boss! Long time no see! I'm here to report
on my mission—
...Huh? Boss man?

(Whoa... I can feel my consciousness...slipping
away...)
Boss man? What's wrong? Boss man?! BOSS MAAAAAN!
Mmm...

Cid wakes up. He's greeted by the concerned
expressions of seven individuals...
Thank goodness. You're awake.

How's the pain? I've been cooling the injured area,
but let me know if you start feeling dizzy or
nauseous.

Let me know if you feel even the slightest
discomfort. I'll take care of you, both
physically and emotionally!

Boss man! Sorry! It's my fault for bumping into
you! I was just so eager to see you!
That's the problem with dogs. No self-control.
Hey, kitty cat! Did you just mock me?!
...Master? Why isn't he reacting...?

Is everything okay? Are you still feeling
disoriented...?
Where am I?

Where...? This is the ancient city of Alexandria.
Our base, remember, Cid?
I'm...Cid?
Yes, you are... Seriously, what's the matter?
Who are all of you?
Huh?

I'm guessing we're pretty close. I mean, you all seem
worried about me.
But, sorry. I don't remember.
No way...! You're joking, right?!
I-It's not funny...
Wait, are you being serious...?
Sorry...
You mean, you have...amnesia?!
"Am-a-neeja"? What's that?

It means he's forgotten...about us...and, based on
what he's said, where he is...and everything else.

Whaaaatt?! I don't want that!! Boss man, remember me!
It's Delta! DELLLTA!!!
Delta, calm down.
Ha-ruff...
Ah...um, sorry. I didn't mean to bring the mood down.
Please don't apologize. It's not your fault!

If you've forgotten...we'll just make you remember.
Simple.

We can help by talking to you about everything. About
us, about the Shadow Garden—something might spark
your memory!
Should we start now? Or give it some time?

Right. We shouldn't rush him. Are you feeling anxious
about having lost your memory, Master Sha—
Beta.

The atmosphere grows tense as Alpha utters a single
word.
Cid, you really don't remember anything?
Huh? Yeah, I don't.

In that case, until your memory returns, there isn't
much we can tell you.
Lady Alpha...?
Also, we'll have to restrict your movements.

Of course, we'll make sure you're treated well and
properly cared for. But until your memory returns,
you'll remain under our watch.
W-Wait, hold on! Why do we need to—
To prevent intel leaks?
Huh? What do you mean?
...Zeta, please escort him to his room.
Understood. Come, let's go.
...Yeah, sure...

As Zeta leads Cid away, Alpha's gaze sweeps over the
remaining members of the Seven Shadows.
I didn't want to do this either. But—

Cid has forgotten that he's Shadow and that our
organization is the Shadow Garden. Of course, this
also means he's forgotten that the true identity of
Shadow is top-secret.

We'll take turns looking after him. This stays a
secret within the Seven Shadows. Agreed?

Everyone nods solemnly in response to Alpha's
instructions,

even as they conceal their individual thoughts and
intentions...

2.Text:
The following day—Cid, having lost a portion of
his memory, is situated in a room inside the
organization's premises.
Master Cid, I've brought your breakfast.
Oh, yeah, thanks. You're...Beta, right?
Y-You remember my name? Has your memory returned?!

Huh? Oh, no. I just remember you being called that
yesterday.
Oh... Right...

Let me to reintroduce myself. My name is Beta.
I'll be looking after you today.

Do you need anything? If something's bothering you,
just let me know, and I'll handle it right away.

I'm good for now. The room comes with a toilet and
shower, after all.
Though, not being able to leave is kind of a drag...

I'm sorry. Given your memory loss, we can't show you
everything inside the building...

So, this place really is that confidential? It's called the
ancient city of Alexandria, right?
I can't disclose those details...

What about the girls I met yesterday? There were
seven, including you, right?
Are they members of this organization?
...I can't comment on that either.

So, why am I here? And what's our relationship?
You're not going to tell me that either?
I sincerely apologize...
Then, what's my relationship with you?
Huh...?

Is it just a coincidence you're the first to come
see me? Or...is there some special reason?
Um... Well... Well...
Well?
...I'll be honest with you.

Beta smiles gently, taking a step toward Cid.
Her cheeks are tinted pink.
Our relationship, Master Cid...

It's personal, outside of the organization. What I
mean is, um... We have a special...mutual desire for
each other, kind of like an...intimate relationship...
Hmm. I see.

Exactly! So, for the sake of our future together,
let's do our best to help you regain your memory!

Beta clasps both of Cid's hands tightly. Meeting her
eyes as she smiles warmly at him, Cid offers a slight
nod.
The next day...

Good morning, Master Cid! I'm Epsilon! I'll be the
one looking after you today.
Epsilon...? Oh, right, nice to meet you...

You seem confused. Do you find my presence
dissatisfactory?

Epsilon gazes at Cid with teary eyes. He hastily
shakes his head.

No, it's not that. I knew there would be someone
different each day, but I kind of thought Beta
would come again today...
Beta?

At the mention of Beta's name, Epsilon's tears
vanish.
...Why would you think that?
Huh? Well...uh... How can I put it...
Have you taken a liking to that air...I mean, woman?

Wait, that woman... Did she do something to you
yesterday, Master Cid?! Did she provide some
special service that's made you want her back
today?!
No, no! It's not like that!

(There's some kind of huge misunderstanding!
...Fine I should just be honest.)

The truth is...according to Beta, we're in an
intimate relationship.

...Excuse me? An intimate relationship? Is that what
Beta said?

More precisely, she said, "It's personal, outside of
the organization. We have a special mutual desire
for each other, kind of like an intimate relationship..."

Hearing Cid's honest confession, Epsilon, whose
expression had been blank, breaks into a smile.
Master Cid, that's a misunderstanding.
...Huh?

When she said "kind of like" an intimate relationship,
she just meant it bears some "vague resemblance"—
nothing like the real thing.
You mean, it was just a metaphor?
Exactly.

Epsilon confirms firmly before letting out a deep
sigh.

She often does that. Exaggerates both her stories and
her breasts...
...Her stories and her breasts?

That's right. So, please don't believe everything you
hear. As for me, you can trust me. Because...

We have a pure and honest relationship. There are no
lies between us. And, unlike her, I'm all natural.

But, despite my appearance, I'm actually super
reserved...and yet, a part of me yearns for a
passionate bond with you, Master Cid.

Heheh... Now, is that a metaphor or not? Which do you
think it is, Master Cid? Only kidding...

(I was too distracted by the magic she uses on her
breasts to properly listen. It's way over the top...
No, I shouldn't say anything.)

(That said, whether it's Beta yesterday or Epsilon
today, they're providing minimum information and
seem to be blending in some falsehoods.)

(While I don't sense malice or ill-intent...it's
dangerous to trust them too much.)

Recognizing his inability to fully comprehend the
situation, Cid concludes he shouldn't rashly
antagonize the seven girls.

However, he also realizes he shouldn't fully trust
them. With this in mind, Cid opts to cautiously
interact with the seven girls...

3.Text:
Several days have elapsed since Cid lost a portion of
his memory...

I still can't remember anything about you guys,
this place, or this organization.

Hmm... Well, there's no rush, Cid. You're still you,
after all.

The one who says this is today's caretaker, Zeta.
She efficiently attends to his needs.
...Alright, done. Anything else you'd like?

Thanks. Not at the moment... Though I would like to
leave this room soon.

That's not solely up to me. But I'll relay your
message.

I don't think staying in this room will help me
recover my memories.

In fact, I still don't have a clue what kind of
person I was, even though it seems I had
connections with all of you.
Not even a clue?
No, not really.

You may be a far more incredible person than you
think, Cid.
Huh?

As Cid blinks in surprise, Zeta silently approaches,
her tail gently brushing him.

At the very least, you're someone incredibly dear
to me...

...Although, Cid, I'm only saying this because you
don't have your memory right now.

Blushing slightly, Zeta playfully rubs her tail
against him.
I-I see...

(She seems to be complimenting me, but I can't
concentrate on what she's saying... What's with
the way she's acting...?)
Just as Cid is about to ask—
BOSS MAAAAAAN!!!
The room's door bursts off its hinges.
Hey, kitty cat! What're you doing here?!
(I'm pretty sure this is the girl called Delta.)

What're you doing in Boss man's room?! It's my turn
to take care of him today!
You were late. I already finished up long ago.
Whaaaat?! Don't take my job! That's stealing!

I step in to do your job for you, and this is the
thanks I get?

I'm guessing since you didn't show up, you must've
forgotten it was your turn, didn't you?

Ngh... I-I might've taken a nap...but I didn't
forget!

Anyway, kitty cat! Stop that tail thing! Don't mark
Boss man with your scent!
(Ah, was that tail movement a way of marking me?)

Since I did a certain someone's job for them,
I'm just leaving my mark as proof.

You...! Now I'm pissed off! You're not getting away
with this!
Jeez, what an impulsive dumb dog.

A physical fight between Delta and Zeta breaks out
inside the room with the door blown off. Cid takes
cover under the bed.

(...What the heck? They're going all out and
destroying everything indoors... Huh?)

Suddenly sensing someone's presence, he glances
toward the entrance to see a girl radiating an
intimidating aura.
What do you think you two are doing?
Delta?
Ulp...
Zeta?

Their fight, violent enough to wreck the room,
ceases instantly.

(Picking massive fights, getting dragged into them...
Stopping fights with words and intimidation... This
place might actually be pretty dangerous...)
A few days later...

With the room Cid was confined in destroyed, he is
given permission to freely roam the organization's
building.

(There are still areas off-limits to me, but this
feels much healthier than being unable to move
around.)

(Within the areas I'm allowed to roam, I need to
gather as much information as possible about this
organization and myself...)
...Heh...heheheh...

(Hm? I thought I heard something... Was it coming
from that room?)

Peeking stealthily into the room where the eerie
voice emanates from, Cid notices it's filled with
suspicious chemicals and equipment.
(Is this...a lab? It's a total mess...)
(And isn't that girl...Eta?)
Hehehehe... It's ready...!

Once I administer this...heh heh heh...! The plan
will be set in motion...after tomorrow's dinner...
under the guise of looking after him...!

(Looking after him... Wait, is she talking about me?!
Is she planning on drugging me?!)

Even if the drug fails...I'll replicate the head
trauma that caused his memory loss...or I'll
employ Shadow Wisdom...to drop a lightning
bolt on him...

(This is bad... She's gonna use me as...a human test
subject!)

Witnessing the mad scientist's mumblings and sinister
laughter, Cid quickly retreats from the door and
hurries away.

As Cid flees the lab, in his distress, he rounds the
corner and nearly runs into a young girl walking
in the other direction.
Eeek!
Oops, sorry... You're Gamma, right?

Master Cid?! I-I'm so sorry! I wasn't paying
attention and didn't see you there...

D-Don't worry about it. I wasn't really paying
attention, either.

But I'm glad I ran into you here. I've actually been
looking for you.

Your head injury should be on the mend by now. We'd
need Alpha's permission, but how about a change of
scenery? Fancy a trip to town?

Having accepted Gamma's invitation, Cid is led into
town by her.

(I was blindfolded until we reached town, probably to
conceal sensitive information... It's clear I'm being
kept in some secret organization.)

I never imagined we'd be strolling through town
together again so soon, Master Cid. I guess I should
thank Delta and Zeta for wrecking your room.

Does anything feel familiar? The drifting scents,
the sounds around us... Nothing ring a bell?

Um, you know... Walking through town like this, just
the two of us, it kinda feels like we're...lovers or
something. W-Wait... Why did I just say that?!

(Two individuals capable of wreaking havoc on a room,
and a scientist attempting to conduct experiments on
me...)

(And then there's that woman who seems to be in
charge, radiating that totally intimidating aura...)

(This secret organization is highly dangerous. Why
was I ever involved with these people before losing
my memory? But...this ends here!)

Wh-What if we...you know, actually became lovers...?
Wait, Master Cid?

Ooh! That music sounds kinda familiar! It's coming
from over there!

Shouting a blatant lie, Cid dashes off as quickly as
a startled rabbit.
Wha—?! H-Hold on, wait... Eek!
(She tripped?! But now's my chance!)
Pl-Please, wait! Master Cid?! Cid!!!

Cid runs desperately, the echoes of Gamma's voice
ringing hollow throughout the town...

4.Text:
Having shaken off Gamma and successfully escaped from
the suspicious organization, Cid walks through the
bustling town.

(What should I do now? They might start searching for
me. Maybe I should hide somewhere, but...)

(Who can I rely on? Where should I go? I can't
remember anything. Hmm...)
Hey, Cid!

Stopping when he hears his name, Cid notices the
lanky silhouette of a boy approaching from ahead.

(...Who's that? He's not much of a looker...
Nope, definitely not.)

I've been wondering where you've been lately. What're
you doing here? You've been skipping school for way
too long.
Huh?

(Am I a student? Wait, is this guy from the
organization...? Nah, probably not.)

Well, whatever. There are things in life that matter
more than classes. For me...it's THIS!
...A notebook?

It's a notebook filled with battle data. Amateurs
might bet on a whim, but not me. I study the data,
crunch the numbers, and place my bets based on
the odds.

But as I persevered down my own path, I've lately hit
something of a wall... That's when it dawned on me.
It's time to move up to the next stage.
Wow, interesting.

Yeah, I'm at a point where I'm ready to have
a master. I'm on my way to train under the
Victorious Golden Dragon, Goldy Gilded.

The Victorious Golden Dragon Goldy Gilded? Sounds
flashy and strong. But is he really? Strong?

He looks pretty damn strong. By my estimate,
his Battle Power is significant.

(If he really is that strong, he might be able to
protect me. Besides, I don't have anywhere else
to go.)
Can you take me with you to meet this Goldy Gilded?
Huh? Why?

I was held captive by an evil organization and
managed to break free. I'd like Goldy's protection.

Man...if that's your excuse for skipping school, you
should've come up with something more convincing.
Also, I've lost my memory.
Yeah, yeah, whatever.

(He's not buying any of it. But everything I've said
is the truth.)
Skel takes Cid to visit Goldy Gilded.
I see. I get the gist of your situation.

You wanna rely on me, huh? Heh. You've got
potential.

(This guy stands out and looks tough...but there's
something off about him.)

In other words, you...sorry, what was your name
again?
It's Cid.

Right, Cid. So you were captured by an evil
organization that was about to experiment
on you, and you managed to escape.
Yes, that's correct. Can you help me?

Master Goldy, you don't have to bother with him.
He's just being stubborn because he can't come
up with a decent excuse for skipping classes.

Now, don't be like that, Skel. He's trying hard to
make an excuse just so he can train under me.

(He's really running his mouth. But if I don't get
accepted here, I'll have to go to that "academy.")

(And that organization will definitely track me down.
It's best to hide somewhere completely unexpected.)
Yes, I want to train under you—as your student.
You really are desperate.

Hahaha. Nothing wrong with that. It's unusual for
someone to be so enthusiastic about becoming my
protégé. Uhm... What was your name again?
It's Cid.

Right, Cid. I'll take you in as my protégé, and you
can hide from that evil organization or whatever.
Thank you.
M-Master Goldy, in that case, me too!

Of course! Moi, the Victorious Golden Dragon Goldy
Gilded, will take both of you under my wing!

And so, Cid becomes a student of Goldy Gilded,
securing himself a place to hide away from the
organization.

Several days have elapsed since Cid's escape from the
Shadow Garden...
...Are you certain about that?
Yes. This intel was gathered by Nu.

Master Shadow is currently...an apprentice of Goldy
Gilded, dedicated to training day and night—
How did this happen...?

It's because Gamma let him escape! If it were me,
Boss man wouldn't have run away!
Enough.
Y-Yes, ma'am...

I doubt he decided to run away on the spot.
He probably wanted to escape even before that.

He only interacted with a limited number of members
after losing his memory. Did someone make him
suspicious while looking after him?
I don't think it's just that.
What do you mean?

From the intel I gathered, he apparently mentioned
something about "being used for experiments by an
evil organization."
*yawn*

Amidst the piercing gazes of the other six, Eta yawns
nonchalantly.

The issue is that he saw us as an "evil organization."
If it weren't for that...he might've thought it was a
medical procedure...
Sounds like a weak excuse.

Either way, we can't draw any conclusions at this
point.

It's concerning to have him wandering outside without
his memory, but dragging him back here won't make
him forget his distrust. He'll just find another chance
to escape.

For now, we watch and wait. All of you, refrain from
acting on your own.

Hearing Alpha's quiet order, the atmosphere in the
room grows tense.

5.Text:
Cid has become a student of Goldy Gilded to hide from
the "evil organization." He has now come to the forest
to receive training under him.

(I would've been fine with being his student in name
only, but if he's taking time out of his busy schedule
to train me, I guess I should take it seriously.)

Good, good... Seems you two have gotten the hang of
measuring Battle Power. Your calculations aren't too
shabby.

Skel, thanks to being self-taught, you seem pretty
familiar with the technique. Going forward, work on
speeding up your calculations and crunching more
numbers.
Understood! Thank you, Master Goldy!
As for you...umm...
It's Cid.

Right, Cid. You've got a sharp eye for details. With
proper training, you have the potential to yield
exciting results.
Thank you, Master Goldy.

From here on out, I'll delve into more advanced
teachings. As the protégés of moi, the Victorious
Golden Dragon Goldy Gilded, I expect both of you
to embody my essence.

So...I want you both to come up with your own
nicknames.

Nicknames?! You mean, like your "Victorious
Golden Dragon" title? We can call ourselves
something like that?!

Oh man, I'm getting all riled up! What should I go
with?!

I've got somewhere to be, so I'll ask for your
nicknames tomorrow. Consider it homework,
Skel and... um…
It's Cid.
Right, Cid. Now, if you'll excuse me.

(Come up with my nickname... Something about this
task excites me.)

("Red Comet," "Human Typhoon," "Spawn of Satan," or
something like that—)

Suddenly, a piercing pain shoots through Cid's head.
He winces and clutches his forehead, drawing a
concerned and puzzled look from Skel.
What's the matter, Cid?
...N-Nothing.

If you're drawing a blank, want me to come up with
something? Given your lack of presence, maybe...
It's fine. I'll think of something myself.

(What's this sensation? Have I done something like
this in the past? If so...)

Experiencing a sense of déjà vu from Goldy Gilded's
task, Cid decides to focus even more on his training,
hoping it might lead to recovering his lost memories.
A few days later...
Master Goldy, I'm back.
Back already?
Yes, I ran 100 laps from here to the forest entrance.
I see. Faster than I thought. Well done, um...
It's Cid.

Right, Cid. Sorry, I'm usually good with names...but
for some reason, I can't seem to remember yours.
By the way, where's Skel?

(Once Master Goldy mentioned 100 laps...Skel bolted
as soon as he was out of sight...)

...He remembered something urgent he had to do and
left. Anyway, what's next?

Well, as my protégé, you'll need to learn
swordsmanship. To build your strength,
start with 1,000 push-ups and sit-ups.
Understood.
Huh? You realize I said 1,000, right?

...Impressive. Without even a single complaint.
Not bad.

You've got potential. I get how serious you are about
this.

If you carefully follow and complete all my training
instructions...I'll teach you my Special Technique.
S-Special Technique?!
...Agh!
Once again, a sharp pain shoots through Cid's head.
Is something wrong?
N-No, it's nothing. I'd like to start immediately.
Alright, do your best, Ed.
It's Cid.
...Cid. Do your best.
(He never seems to remember my name, but...)

(Whenever I follow his instructions or think about
them, I get hit with this strange feeling.)

(Maybe Goldy Gilded holds the key to unlocking my
lost memories.)

When I look at you, it reminds me of my younger self.
Persistent, earnest...

...Did I shine as brightly as you in my youth?
My memory fails me now...
Master Goldy...

...Never mind that. This is where the real training
starts. Sure you want to learn my Special Technique?!
I do!!!
Alright, then follow me! Youth waits for no one!
Yes, sir!

First, give me 1000 push-ups facing that setting sun!
Think you're up for the challenge, Ed?!
It's Cid!

As the bond between master and student deepens, their
passionate exchanges continue on until nightfall...
...That concludes Nu's report.

Hearing Gamma's report, a palpable tension spreads
among the members in the room.
Master Shadow is learning swordsmanship?

The audacity to teach Master Shadow. Talk about
crossing the line.
(How did things end up like this...)

(My fear of information leaks has led to this
distrust.)

(He may have lost his memories, but for Cid to be
training under someone so inferior...)
I'll go fetch him myself.
What?! You're going yourself, Lady Alpha?!

If you leave it to me, I could easily handle the
likes of Goldy Gilded—
No, this is something I have to do.

(This is all because of my initial error in judgment.
It's my responsibility. That's why I have to retrieve
him myself.)

Alpha's eyes shine with determination. That night,
she departs from the ancient castle of Alexandria
alone, heading to reclaim Cid.

6.Text:
Cid practices his swordsmanship in the forest at
night under the guidance of the Victorious Golden
Dragon, Goldy Gilded.

While you're still nowhere near matching my level,
you seem to be making progress day by day, Cindler.

Thank you, Master Goldy. By the way, it's Cid,
not Cindler.
Oh, right. Almost got it.
(He wasn't anywhere close to getting it... Huh?)

You've persevered through my tough training.
The day may soon come when...
Master Goldy, did you sense something just now?

Sense something? Can't say I did. But then again,
we are in the forest at night.

There could be animals watching us. But since I still
haven't trained you in sensing presences, it's likely
just in your head.
I see...

Just as Cid is about to be convinced, there is the
soft sound of footsteps.
Hm?
...Goldy Gilded, I presume.

From the dark forest emerges a young girl who appears
to be the leader of the organization that imprisoned
Cid.
I'll spare you this once. Leave him and disappear.

Hmph... Quite the bold words, young lady. It appears
you only know my name and nothing of my reputation.

Master Goldy! This girl is a member of that evil
organization!

What? This young lady? Hmmm... Based on her delicate
build and the fact she's recklessly showed up unarmed,
I'd say her Battle Power is around 45.
Alright, Cidney, consider this hands-on training.
Huh?

You've weathered intense training. Now it's time to
experience an actual fight.

If you take out those pursuing you, it solves all of
your problems. I take it you've prepared a nickname
and a Special Technique to break free from this life
in hiding?

Y-Yes! I'll give it my all! And for the record,
it's not Cidney.

With that said, Cid turns his back to Goldy and
confronts the girl from the "evil organization."

I am Cid, Shadow of the Ebony Darkness! Student of
the Victorious Golden Dragon, Goldy Gilded!
...You plan on fighting me?
I want to be free! And for that...I'll fight!

Cid swings his training sword in a wide arc. She
leaps back to avoid the strike, a pained expression
on her face.
Ack...!

(Is she flinching? I might have a chance at winning
this!)
Come on, just leave me alone!
I can't do that...!
Then...you leave me no choice but to take you down!

Cid's aggressive swordsmanship appears to give him
the upper hand. She counters with a sword she calls
forth, but she's clearly on the defensive.
Not good. At this rate—
W-Wait!

Chase her, Cinclair. If she escapes too deep into the
forest, tracking her down will be tough.
Yes, sir!

Cid chases after the girl's silhouette as she flees
deeper into the dark forest.

Urgh...! You may have lost your memories, but your
sword skills remain intact.

I have no idea what you're talking about. I owe my
sword skills to Master Goldy!

I'll show you! Demonic Golden Dragon! Fatality
Strike!

The flow of golden energy coalesces into an image of
a glimmering dragon. Beyond the dragon stands the girl,
her expression one of frustration.
(I can end this with my Special Technique. But...)

(There's something off about this. It just doesn't
suit me, or...I don't know, just doesn't feel right...)
...This isn't like you!

Perhaps sharing her thoughts, Cid hesitates just as
he's about to unleash his Special Technique.
Wh-What...?

The Cid I know doesn't go around boasting. You lurk
in the darkness and hunt down shadows... That's who
you are!

Also...you don't wield your sword just for yourself.
You fight for the sake of the world!
You are our Shadowbroker! Remember...your name!
M-My name is...

(...Do I have a name besides "Cid"? Shadowbroker...
Something about that feels familiar.)

(...Yeah, it sounds kinda cool! Simple, but as a
nickname, it's way better than "Shadow of the
Ebony Darkness"!)

(Heh... I bet it'll sound even cooler if added a
title. Let's see... Master...)
...Shadow.
N-Nghh...?!

At that moment, a flurry of scenes flash through
Cid's mind. Among these memories is her face.
...What did you say your name was just now...?

(That's right, I chose to erase my memories back
then. The specifics are hazy...but it definitely
feels like I gained some valuable experiences.)

Looks like I caused you quite a bit of trouble,
Alpha.
The aura around Cid shifts...
That's all over now.
Cid... No, Shadow. I'm glad you're back.

Let's go home to where we belong—to the Shadow
Garden.
Wait.

As Shadow turns his gaze to the dark forest,
a golden, glittering figure approaches.

Huh? You're the young lady from earlier, and...who
might you be? Cinclair doesn't seem to be with you
two... Hmm.

Judging by the situation, he lost and was abducted...
As his master, I can't let this slide!
(Who's this sparkly chad again...?)
Moi, Goldy Gilded, will settle this score myself!

Just so you're aware, my Battle Power is 4,300! I'm
about to add another notch to my streak of being
undefeated! Haha... Don't say I didn't warn you!

(He's spilling the beans on all his secrets...
Typical side character move!)

(I'd love to play along, but he doesn't seem very
level-headed. Probably best to stop him here.)

In order to calm down the dazzling Goldy seeking
vengeance for his student, Shadow and Alpha
confront him face to face.

7.Text:
Having regained his composure, Goldy Gilded glares
at Shadow and Alpha with a look of frustration.

Don't give us that look. We don't intend on pursuing
your student any further.
What?

I initially thought he had seen something he
shouldn't have. But after hearing him out,
it turns out he hadn't seen anything, so I
let him go.
Then, where did he go?

Now that he's safe, he doesn't need to hide under
your wings forever. He's just a student, after all.
Maybe he went back to school?

...I see. Guess it's no easy feat to find someone who
can step into my shoes.
Just to be clear—I wasn't defeated by the two of you.

Two against one isn't fair. My stomping ground is
the arena, and my fighting style is tailored for
one-on-one battles.
(He's really sore about losing.)

You wouldn't want to be labeled as cowards either,
would you? We'll declare this match a draw and
move on.
...How considerate of you.
(...Who was that sparkly side character anyway?)

(...First, I need to assess the situation. I should
ask Alpha what happened—)
You completely fooled us.
Huh?

You feigned losing your memory to gauge the
Shadow Garden's organizational strength,
didn't you?

To see if we would function properly without you.
To test if we could handle unexpected situations.
And also...

You wanted to remind us, the Seven Shadows...of the
strain and nerves we felt before being assigned to
commanding positions, didn't you?
(That's an...unexpected interpretation!)
Alpha's gaze pierces straight into Shadow.

(It's too late to claim I just lost my memory...
Alpha probably won't buy that... Okay, I'll play
along with her interpretation.)

...Precisely. I'm impressed you've seen through it.
And you faced my trials admirably... You've passed.

I really should have seen through it sooner. I still
have a lot of learning to do.

We should inform the others as well. You're planning
to meet with them now, aren't you?
Yeah. It's time for answers...

Shadow nods. The next moment, the two silently
disappear from the night forest.

Cid stands at the clock tower at night. The Seven
Shadows are behind him.

...So, that's how it is. That's a summary of the
events and Master Shadow's intentions.

Boss, you won't be leaving again, will you? Are you
back for good?

Yes, the charade is over. I trust our future
objectives are now more clear.

If you're feeling complacent, you'd best snap out of
it. We are the Shadow Garden... We lurk in the
darkness and hunt down shadows.

Yes, I'll keep doing my best to contribute to your
power, my lord—
...Huh? Wait, does that mean...
I'll hunt a lot, too! Awwoooo!
I look forward to plenty of your...Shadow Wisdom.

Each in their own way, the members of the Seven
Shadows reaffirm their loyalty to Shadow and the
Shadow Garden.

Our resolve has been strengthened, and we have been
able to express our commitment. That was quite the
wake-up call.

Is this the outcome you wanted Our battle against the
Cult is only going to intensify. Did you want us to
get back to the basics?
Heh... The path we're on is fraught with challenges.

...As Shadow's wise words sink in, Alpha, Eta, and
Delta break into relieved smiles. Meanwhile,
however...
...The memory loss...was a lie...

So, you were aware of my intentions then, Master
Shadow... Aahhh...!!!

Eeeeeep!!! A passionate bond?! What the heck was I
thinking?!

...My lord, so you saw through everything...
Ngh... What was I thinking...?!

N-No way... You remember everything I said...about
us being like l-l-l-lovers on a date...?!

As the four recall their words, actions, and attempts
to manipulate Cid during his memory loss, they squirm
in embarrassment.
